intro: Psychotria turboensis, commonly known as the Turbo's psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found growing in shaded, humid environments, typically in the understory of tropical forests. The plant has been studied for its potential pharmacological properties due to the presence of various alkaloids.
